page.title: 0205340178: Housing Bermondsey
page.content: Virtually the whole of this area consists of post-war council housing. In the southern half of the block the Victorian terraces have completely disappeared and have been replaced by high-rise and medium-rise blocks in which the local community has been rehoused. the Tower blocks around Avondale square are visible from most of the area. In the northern half of the block there are still some Victorian terraces of two-story maisonettes. There is also a 1980's development of high density single-unit small terraced houses. Across the centre of the block runs a belt of disused, derelict marshalling yards belonging to British Rail. Southwark Park Road is the major shopping centre, being lined with shops of every description.
